intro: Lasiosiphon villosus, commonly known as the hairy siphon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often blooming during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. Lasiosiphon villosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
